statement: The refactor should enforce mandatory critic passes for all tasks, standardizing naming as rubric_critic and score_critic (replacing probe naming) while preserving expert-agreement calibration in the scoring stage.
rationale: Current pipeline uses rubric critic and scoring prober; user requires mandatory critics and standardized naming, and paper methodology depends on expert-agreement data.
keyAssumptions: Critic passes are required for ECC/control/benchmark tasks and should not be optional.
validationCriteria: Blueprint plan includes mandatory score_critic for every score row and schema fields aligned to critic naming.
critiquePoints: Mandatory critics increase cost and latency; scope may need tuning for large runs.
questions: Is score_critic required per evidence item or per sample batch?
Should critic outputs be stored as full text or only parsed scores in domain tables?
